meanings.sent1: She eulogises her best friend for always being there for her.
meanings.sent2: The community eulogises the brave firefighters who risk their lives to save others.
meanings.sent3: At the party, everyone eulogises the delicious cake made by Sarah.
meanings.sent4: His speech eulogises the power of kindness in changing the world.
meanings.sent5: The teacher eulogises the hard work and dedication of her students.

meanings.definition: To speak or write in praise of.
meanings.sent1: He eulogises the beauty of nature in his poems.
meanings.sent2: During the ceremony, the priest eulogises the life of the departed soul.
meanings.sent3: The comedian eulogises his favorite snack in a hilarious stand-up routine.
meanings.sent4: Her painting eulogises the resilience of the human spirit in times of adversity.
meanings.sent5: The author eulogises the courage of the main character in the novel.
